meanings.definition: To act as a subordinate or underling, especially in a comedic act.
meanings.sent1: During the play, I stooged around on stage, following the lead actor's funny antics.
meanings.sent2: In the comedy skit, the actor stooged around, playing the role of the bumbling sidekick.
meanings.sent3: The audience burst into laughter as I stooged clumsily behind the main comedian.
meanings.sent4: I felt like a puppet on strings, stooged into playing the fool for everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent5: My role was to stooge around and make the audience smile with my silly actions.

meanings.definition: To be manipulated or used by someone else for their own benefit.
meanings.sent1: He stooged me into doing his chores while he relaxed on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to stooge others into doing her work for her.
meanings.sent3: I realized I had been stooged into running errands for my lazy friend.
meanings.sent4: Feeling like a pawn, I was stooged into helping with tasks that weren't mine.
meanings.sent5: Don't let yourself be stooged into taking on responsibilities that aren't yours to bear.

meanings.definition: To be set up or tricked by someone else.
meanings.sent1: I was stooged into believing the fake news story that circulated online.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed after being stooged into falling for the prank.
meanings.sent3: My friends stooged me by pretending my birthday was forgotten, only to surprise me later.
meanings.sent4: Feeling deceived, I realized I had been stooged into buying a faulty product.
meanings.sent5: Being stooged by my siblings in harmless pranks always brings laughter to our home.
